actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
source: RFI; AMAP; Reuters; Jeune Afrique; Kibaru
notes: On September 30, suspected JNIM and/or ISGS militants attacked the military camp of Malian contigent of the G5Sahel Force in Boulikessi nearly simultaneously with an assault on the National Guard camp in Mondoro, at least 38 soldiers were killed, 30 gone missing, 15 assailants killed, and at least two civilians killed in the crossfire. Both camps were overrun and destroyed, and large amounts of arms and ammunition carted away. Fatalities split between (2) events on September 30 with (28) fatalities for Boulikessi and (27) for Mondoro.

Three national INGO personnel, two staff and a driver, were kidnapped along with their vehicle. Unknown armed assailants riding motorcycles ambushed the INGO vehicle near Wally village, 20 km east of Hombori town, Douentza cercle. Further information is not available at this time.

On September 23, Fulani militiamen from Balaguina-Foube attacked and torched the neighboring Dogon village Balaguina-Habe, no casualties reported.

On September 22, unknown gunmen attacked the village of Ganida, and killed one individual, wounded two others, and seized livestock.

notes: On September 19, a demonstration in Niono in response to misguided fire by security forces against a motorcyclist spinned out of control when youths killed the police chief, ransacked the police station, and burned vehicles, the ensuing clashes left a youth and others wounded, in addition to twenty-two members of the security forces wounded including some severely.

On September 19, two children aboard a vehicle were shot dead and their mother severely wounded by gunfire in Timbuktu, possibly on account of their physical appearance of belonging to Arab community. CMA accused the Malian army of the killings.

On September 18, individuals aboard a vehicle forced a checkpoint held by youths in the Abaradjou quarter of Timbuktu, they also opened fire and gunshot wounded two youths, the assailants escaped but their vehicle was set ablaze.

On September 18, predominantly Songhai youth attacked homes and pillaged and ransacked shops belonging to the Arab community in Timbuktu, in reaction to abductions and robberies attributed to members of the Arab and Tuareg communities. [size=large]

source: Koro Kibaru; Le Pays Dogon; Mali Canal

notes: On 15 March, a cart was struck by an IED about 3km north of Tougere-Coumbe, area of Tenenkou, Mopti Region, one civilian was killed and another severely wounded, the two donkeys that pulled the cart were also killed. The IED was most likely planted by JNIM militants.

On 15 March, unknown gunmen seized a vehicle belonging the NGO Directorate for Social Development and Economic Solidarity of Kidal (DRDSES) in Gao, the driver of the vehicle was gunshot wounded in the leg and rushed to hospital.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On 14 March, presumed JNIM militants fired two mortar shells that landed on a civilian house and near the MOC camp in Gao, without causing casualties.

On 14 March, residents in Koro, Mopti protested against local officials and their ineptitude to solve the intercommunal crisisbetween Dogons and Fulani in the area, they also accused the prefect of being at the root of the problems.

assoc_actor_1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation
notes: On 11-12 March, joint forces of Operation Barkhane, GATIA, MSA and the Malian and Nigerien armies carried out operations against the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara in Mali-Niger borderland. In the wake of the operation MSA announced and provided visuals as proof that they had recovered a vehicle and weapons seized from U.S. Green Berets in an earlier attack by ISGS militants in Tongo Tongo, Niger back in October. Seven militants were killed in the operation, three arrested, and four vehicles, 13 motorbikes, arms including rockets, ammunition and other materiel seized. One militiaman was also killed and three others wounded.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On 12 March, presumed Katiba Macina militants and Dozos clashed between Nouhoun-Bozo and Koa, Cercle of Djenne, Mopti Region not far from Diafarabe, eleven Dozos were killed and others wounded, one militant was also wounded in the clashes.

assoc_actor_1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation

Property destruction: On March 11, Dogon militiamen burned three huts and killed two sheep in the village of Madougou.
On 11 March, Dozo militiamen killed ten civilians of the Fulani ethnic group in the hamlet of Diaou, area of Diafarabe.
On 11 March, Dogon militiamen killed two Fulani men in the area of Douna-pen, near Dioungani.
On 10 March, Dogon militiamen killed two civilians of the Fulani ethnic group in the bush near Omo camp in Koro.
On March 9, Dogon donzos (traditional hunters) attacked and burned the hamlet of Bodewal, near Mbana, one individual was killed in the attack.

On March 8, Fulani gunmen attacked the village of Sabere Darah, between Koro and Dioungani, Mopti. The attacks targeted the Dogon community, at least four individuals were reported to have been killed. Houses, reserves of crops and sheds burned, and boreholes destroyed.

actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

Youth burned tires and fired shots in the air furious about the death of a national guard shot dead earlier by unknown gunmen.

The community leaders eventually agreed to a peace agreement between the two communities.

actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: French forces of Operation Barkhane carried out a multi-pronged operation targeting senior commanders of JNIM's Ansar Dine branch. Airstrikes engaged three targets, followed by helicopter drops and ground operation by commandos between Boughessa and Tin Zaouaten in the far north Kidal Region. The operation resulted in a total of 23 militants killed or captured. Fatalities split between two events. Two individuals killed near Boughessa, more precisely in the Aouhou area were identified as the former mayor of Boughessa and his son-in-law, presumably also others accompanying the former.

Nearly a thousand people demonstrated against US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel. Mobilization at the call of the Muslim community of the country.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)

Malian railway workers decided to organize a sit-in on December 12 in the courtyard of the Dakar-Bamako railway to claim four months of unpaid wages.
A notable of the Imghad community was killed in this area on 10/12.

A joint cross-border military operation took place from 3 to 20 December on both sides of the Malo-Mauritanian border in the Ouagadou Forest. A detachment of Barkhane was involved alongside the Malian armed forces.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: 5 civilians were executed today near Niono by Fulani jihadists. They were in this area for the installation of optical fiber.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: After an attempted failed kidnapping of the Nara prefect, the escort elements retaliated by fending off the attackers. Provisional balance sheet: Three FAMA soldiers wounded. Claimed by JNIM on 26/12.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Two MINUSMA agents aboard a hilux vehicle were pointed at Bavaria. One of them was shot in the head and succumbed to his hospital injury. The attackers fled. The vehicle was damaged.
One civilian dead and one wounded following the passage of a truck on a mine in Wailalam about 04 km southwest of Adielhoc.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

The secretary general at the Mayor's office in Dioungani, Cercle of Koro, Region, assassinated at his home this evening in the village of Gourti not far from the Burkina Faso border
A group of preachers commemorating the Mawlid were attacked by gunmen near Niono.

"One INGO national staff member was brutally assaulted at the organization's compound in Menaka, Mali. Items were stolen after the attack. The staff member had to be medically evacuated for treatment and then travel outside of the country for additional medical support."

Forest guard and his guide killed by unknown gunmen at the market in Dah, near Sokoura, Mopti Region
At the market in Garnati, 50km east of Niafunke, gunmen opened fire and killed a retired National Guard.
A trader kidnapped in Atara, 25 km from Niafunke, by armed men.

People gathered to denounce the sale of human beings in Libya. The mobilization began with a sit-in in front of the Libyan Embassy in Bamako. Malians chained themselves to each other in front of the building with faded walls, in front of which was deployed a large cordon of policemen
Guide of FAMa's anti-poaching brigade assassinated at his home in Hombori.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: FAMa patrol ambushed near Dioungani, Mopti, 5 wounded soldiers, casualties unknown in the ranks of the presumed militants. Claimed by JNIM on November, 24: 8 killed 2 vehicles destroyed and 1 burned, FAMa said 5 wounded.
The President of the Niono District Court was abducted by unknown gunmen in Niono.

actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Reports of airstrikes by helos against two "jihadists" positions in the area of Nampala.

Another attack targeting FAMa checkpoints overnight at the eastern and southern entrance (Menaka & Labbezanga) of Ansongo, assailants routed, no casualties reported.
A former communal councilor from Djougani named Oumar Barry was murdered in Koro by two men on a motorcycle.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: The village chief of Kargue (Lowol Gueou) accused of "collaborating with the Malian army", was assassinated by presumed "jihadists", the locality recently experienced communal violence between Peuls and Dogons.

assoc_actor_1: FPA: Popular Front of Azawad; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation; CPA: Azawad People's Coalition; CJA: Congress for Justice in Azawad; MPSA: Popular Movement for Azawad Salvation
notes: Change to armed group: On 11 November, CME (Coordination des Mouvements de l'Entente) was formed to merge FPA, MSA, CPA, CJA and MPSA forces into a unified front calling for the inclusion of all armed groups in the 2015 peace accord. The movement held its first congress between April 28-30 in Tin-Aouker. Decisions were taken for a unified flag and to establish the movement's structure i.e. the political and military office of the coordination and an office for the youth wings of the movements.

FAMa detected and destroyed an IED planted on a bridge between Djenne and Kouakourou, Mopti. The unit was subjected to gunfire following the triggering of the device but routed the assailants, 1 FAMa wounded, casualties among the assailants unknown.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Attack against FAMa checkpoint at the southern exit of Ansongo towards Labbezanga. Barkhane intervened with airstrikes, body of one assailant was found in the morning, AT-mine, bag with various materiel, 2 motorbikes, 2 PKMs, 2 mags & ammo belts also recovered
Looting: Three transport vehicles carrying health workers en route to Sevare and Bamako were attacked, 30km from Bambara-Maoude, all stripped of their belongings.
Local disturbances in Tessit following the arrest of 6 MNLA fighters amidst the first joint G5Sahel force & Barkhane operation in the tri-state border.
Policeman wounded after armed men seized his vehicle.

Truck struck by IED 12km from Ansongo, 5 civilians killed and 9 wounded

Kidal subjected to mortar/rocket fire (six shells) this morning, still no eventual casualty toll available

Ayorou attackers reportedly subjected to heavy airstrikes by unidentified fighter jet/s (likely FR Mirage 2000). Casualties also reported without further precisions in Amalawlaw, 85km Ayorou and 15km from the Nigerian border.

4 individuals arrested by the Malian army in Boulkessi last Saturday were found to have been executed & buried yesterday by herders.

On 15 October, presumed ISGS militants raided a camp in the locality of Agawayghaway, about 30km from Menaka, three MSA combatants including a senior commander were killed in the attack, the assailants also seized two vehicles.

notes: Position of Fulani self-defense group attacked in Hombori by presumed GATIA, 2 wounded self-defense. Group targeted was established by former Ganda Izo commander Abderrahmane Cisse earlier this year.
Two individuals killed in clashes with Barkhane in the area of Tadalok, not far from Abeibara. Both individuals killed are from the same family,
Several gunshots were heard by locals close to Eastern checkpoint.
FAMA killed 4 militants who previously had executed an alleged informer in Boudjiguire, Cercle of Nara, Koulikoro Region

Militants executed an alleged informer in Boudjiguire, Cercle of Nara, Koulikoro Region
One Water and Forest agent and one civilian killed in Fangasso
Youth throwing stones at Barkhane vehicles patrolling the streets of Kidal
Property destruction: Church burned by unknown gunmen (presumably "jihadists") in Dounapen, near Dioungani (Koro).
Unrest in Kidal, as people took to the streets in continued protests against Barkhane
Iboghilitane fraction chief assassinated by armed men 20 km from Anderamboukane.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

Clashes reported between elements of the MSA and a "group of bandits" in the area of Tamalate near the Niger border. No casualties and attackers repelled in Tamalate.

notes: Looting: A ICRC agent was robbed by armed men on a pick-up.
"Jidahists" said to have taken over Kanio, Kouakourou. Half population left with the army, those who stayed provided supplies and complied with their demands.
A Comanav boat was ambushed on the Niger river by unknown assailants. 5 people were wounded and rescued in Kouakourou.
A FAMa motorcycle was hit by an IED: 2 men dead.

Property destruction: Reportedly, churches are increasingly targeted by Islamist militias in the centre of Mali. Last week, Dobara's church was stripped of its furnishings that were burnt. Others churches have experienced the same accidents.
Malian army post in Imboraghane locality in Gawa area was attacked by armed men.

Protests against racketeering customs officers & gendarmes turned deadly in Koury: 1 protester shot dead & 2 severely wounded by gendarmes; customs station, gendarmerie, Water & Forest Dept. chief's house burned by the protesters.
A MSA checkpoint was attacked by unidentified men: 2 MSA men and 5 assailants killed, several prisoners captured.
President of communal health organization abducted by presumed jihadists in Dioura
Marabout killed and an apprentice abducted by unknown gunmen in Godoware

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

Islamist militants abducted village chief of Sare-Kina.
FAMa vehicle struck by IED in the area of Boulkessi near the Burkina Faso border, 2 Malian soldiers wounded.

Finally, Malian army arrived in Kanio, to conduct patrols, but the usual downside a Peul neighborhood in the village subjected to searches, with multiple families stripped of their belongings and maltreated.

Malian army convoy ambushed along the axis Menaka-Ansongo, 15km from In-Delimane. Provisional toll: 4 Malian soldiers killed & 3 wounded, 2 FAMa vehicles destroyed; 3 vehicles managed to return to Menaka.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

CSREF accountant was attacked by armed men and stripped of money, telephone and pc.

The siege on Kanio, is still in place: an elderly Malinke was shot dead on his property by Islamist miltiants.
2 armed man killed an off duty policeman in the mosquee for the morning prayer.
Looting: Unidentified militants seized 178 cows, and destroyed several fields and water pumps.
Hundreds of persons took the street to protest against the FCFA in Cotonou, Dakar and Bamako. The demonstration was dispersed by police.
A National Guard pick-up was seized after an exchange of fire: 3 guards dead and several civilians wounded. Malian army in pursuit till 5 km from the city.
The siege on Kanio conintues: two civilians killed during the week.
2 Platform pick-ups were attacked: 2 dead and 4 men kidnapped on the Platform side.
An explosion followed by an exchange of fire was reported by Kidal inhabitants.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

A National Guard vehicle was seized after an exchange of fire. One civilian wounded.
Gao's 8th district, airport and the FAMa camp subjected to mortar fire this morning, 2 Malian soldiers lightly wounded
The village of Kanio was besieged by "jihadists" for days following recent clashes with villagers, supplies scarce.
2 men shot to death a person in Kidal city centre.

2 "jihadists" killed by Barkhane (Tigre helos & mountain commandos/paratroopers) on Sept 8, in N'daki near the BurkinaFaso border. 2 pick-ups, 3 motorbikes, 3 AK-47s, ammunition, IED-manufacturing materiel seized.
Attempt to seize a FAMa supply vehicle "foiled" at Menaka market, one soldier killed one wounded.

Attack by 4 gunmen aboard motorcycles of the customs post in Ouonkoro, Cercle of Bankass. No casualties.
3 armed men raided Arkodia village killing a man; they asked the community to enforce charia law before leaving the village.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

actor2: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad

Unidentified assaillants attacked Oudeina village, 70 kms SE of Talatay commune of Menaka, abducting six members of the Dawshak and stealing a vehicle. The bodies of four of the six were later recovered, while the two others were released.
Unknown assaillants riding motorbikes ambushed a group of Malian forces at a water source in Almoustarat, killing two.
Renewed violence between Dogons & Fulanis in Koro, Mopti Region. 1 Dogon killed, 2 wounded & 1 taken prisoner. Dozos from Ke-Macina were said to be en route to reinforce the Dogons.
A Malian army convoy was ambushed between Gossi and Hombori. No reported casualty.

Malian army and National Guard units based in and around Boni, 220 kilometers from the garrison town of Sevare in Mopti region, were extensively linked to torture. For instance, on June 23, soldiers arrested and tortured three traders - two Malians and one Burkinabe - whom they accused of supporting armed Islamists who had attacked the gendarme post in Boni the previous day

Two other men said that on June 22 or 23, they were beaten and one was burned by soldiers based in the military camp at Diabaly, 140 kilometers from Segou. 'They accused me of being involved with the jihadists,' said one man. 'I was held for three nights. On the final night, they beat me on my back, and kicked me with their boots. I'm not sure how long it lasted - I was beaten until I lost consciousness. The next day, they dripped burning plastic all over my shoulder and back."
10 Bambara farmers were found dead in the fields.

On 15 May 2017, a Ouatagouna armed group clashed with an Islamist militia in Ouattagouna (Ansongo, Gao), with 2 reported dead. This follows an attack on the Mayor's office by the Islamist group.
Human Rights Watch also documented the death of a 50-year-old man after he had been severely beaten by Malian soldiers in May. Three witnesses said the man died at the hospital in Sevare.

Human Rights Watch interviewed 18 men and four boys, ages 14 to 17, who alleged being mistreated by soldiers after their arrest in May from villages near Mali's border with Burkina Faso. Two months later, nearly all showed visible scarring around the wrists and ankles; the hands of two men were still bandaged, while six had scabs and scars from what appeared to be deep gashes on their wrists. They said their hands were tied for over two days, including during the long journey from central Mali to Bamako. One man had visible scars around his throat, saying it was from 'when I was attached within the pickup for hours on the bumpy road, with a cord around my throat... they only removed it after I passed out.' Ten of these were initially detained in a joint operation involving the Malian army and French forces.

Human Rights Watch documented the detention of 114 men by Malian security forces in central Mali between December 2016 and June 2017. The detainees, the vast majority of whom were ethnic Peuhl, were held for their suspected support for Islamist armed groups. On May 8, soldiers detained 10 men, ages 19 to about 50, from several hamlets near Boni. All 10 were severely beaten and told they would be shot or burned alive.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

actor1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: JNIM claimed an ambush against a Dozo convoy in Ke-Macina, Segou, killing and wounding several (fatalities coded as 3).

actor2: CJA: Congress for Justice in Azawad

Multiple airstrikes targeting suspected Islamist militants were reported in the Mondoro/Fhero forest area near Burkina Faso's border by French forces.
Several civilians were injured in Gao when unidentified assailants fired into a crowd.
A person searching for their missing cattle was abducted by suspected Islamist fighters in Diafarabe. He was later found dead.

actor2: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (CMA)
notes: 2 MAA fighters (members of the CMA) were killed and at least 6 wounded while some of their vehicles were seized during an attack by an unidentified armed group on their positions in Anefis.
A gendarmerie checkpost was attacked and set on fire in San by unidentified gunmen.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

notes: A French LAV hit a roadside explosive in area of Douna village, injuring 2. AQM claimed responsibility.
A humanitarian worker and two health workers were abducted and had their vehicle seized by unidentified gunmen in Kadial, between Tenenkou and Mopti.

2 educational consultants and the driver of a vehicle owned by CAP were wounded by unidentified gunmen in the Gniminama area as it was traveling from Konna to Douentza.

2 army vehicles were hit by an IED near Niala.
The chief of Dogon section of yirma village near Boni was killed at his home by unidentified assailants.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

3 people were killed and 4 wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants on a Malian army post in Almoustarat. Vehicles were also seized by the attackers.

actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

Malian soldiers raided Kouakourou in the Kewa area and clashed with alleged Islamist militants, killing 10. At least 8 other alleged Islamist militants were arrested, while 30 others were also reported arrested (not clear if they were also militants or just suspected of affiliation).
Unidentified assailants clashed with security forces in the Boni area.
A customs post in Ouelessebougou was attacked by suspected Islamist militants. At least one customs officer was killed and another wounded.
Unidentified assailants robbed two busses near Intahaka after leaving Gao. Some of the passengers who resisted were wounded, and one later died in hospital.
At least 3 people were killed at Diaka in Tenenkou Cercle in fighting between Fulani and Bambara.

source: RFI; AFP; Nord Sud Journal; Long War Journal
notes: At least 10 people were killed and 14 others injured in clashes between Bambara and Fulani in the Diabaly area of Niono. The clashes were either due to a Fulani shepherd being killed or Fulani cattle rustling. AQM militants claimed that they joined the fight and supported the Fulani.
3 people were lightly wounded after their transport truck hit an IED in the Tabrichat area near Tessalit.
A young Fulani shepherd was allegedly killed by Bambara militiamen in Niono district of Segou.
A Malian gendarmerie post was attacked in the Tonka area.

In late March 2017, gendarmes in Sevare allegedly beat seven men from a village near Djenne, including a Quranic teacher. 'During the night, a few of the gendarmes came into our cell and kicked and beat us. One man broke a few ribs and two others bled from their noses,' one detainee said.

actor1: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
notes: Unidentified assailants killed an MNLA officer in the Ouzayane valley north of Abeibara.
A Bambara hunter was killed in an ambush by unidentified gunmen in the Tougou area of Segou. Intercommunal violence targeting Bambara was recently reported in the area.

actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: GATIA's commander Almahdi Ag Lengach was killed in Menaka by 3 unidentified assailants who arrived on motorcycles.
One Bambara community member was killed and several wounded during intercommunal violence reported in the Dogofri-Diabaly area.

actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: At least 4 people were killed, including 2 soldiers and 2 civilians, in an attack by 9 suspected AQM fighters on Fafa. 2 military vehicles were also stolen by the attackers. Some people were also reported injured. Other sources said 3 civilians had been killed.

actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Unidentified assailants attacked a GATIA checkpost in Tin-Hama. The attack was repelled without reported injuries.

At least 3 people were injured in an attack by unidentified assailants on two buses owned by a Mauritanian company which were travelling from Bamako to Nouakchott. The bus carried people of various nationalities.
Armed groups took control of Timbuktu to prevent Malian interim authorities from being installed in the area. No clashes were reported.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)

source: Nord Sud Journal; AP; Menastream; RFI
notes: At least 11 soldiers were killed and 4 injured in an attack by Ansaroul Islam fighters on an army position in the Boulkessi area of Mopti. 2 Ansaroul Islam fighters were reported wounded.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: The MINUSMA camp in Aguelhok was hit by rockets/mortars. No group claimed responsibility.
2 civilians were killed and 3 abducted by suspected Islamist militants in Funtonde, 8km from Boni.
Youths in Koiratao (Niafunke) repulsed an attack by armed bandits. They captured one and handed him over to the army.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Non-violent activity: Ansar Dine, al-Mourabitoun and AQIM have announced their merger into a new group, "Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimeen," which translates to "Group in Support of Islam and Muslims".

assoc_actor_1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad (Splinter Faction)
notes: Elements of the CMA2 (dissenters from the peace process) picketed the regional assembly in Timbuktu demanding that they be involved in decision-making and other initiatives related to Timbuktu region.
About 2,000 armed members of the Ganda Izo vigilante group picketed the regional assembly to demand the cancellation of the implementation of interim authorities.
Dozens of allegedly "well-organized" young Muslims ransacked bars and liquor stalls in Timbuktu during a protest against alcohol.
10 Dozo hunters (Bambara) were killed and 13 wounded when they were ambushed by Islamist militants in the Diabaly area.
2 suspected Islamist militants were killed and 3 arrested in an early-morning operation by French Barkhane forces in Tin Afaghout in the Boughessa area.
At least 3 Fulani herders were killed by Dozo hunters in the Ke-Macina area.
2 people were abducted in Dialloube by suspected Islamist militants.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: 4 MINUSMA peacekeepers were wounded when their vehicle hit an IED 50km south of Aguelhok.
One person was killed and 15 wounded when a bus hit an IED between Gossi and Hombori.
An ambush in Tonka by unidentified assailants resulted in 5 soldiers injured and 1 killed. 2 later died of their injuries.
People protested against the designations for the Interim Authorities in Timbuktu.

9 traders, most of whom were from the Bozo ethnic group, were killed by armed Islamist militants in the Monimpe area, near Macina. The attack is believed to be related to recent ethnic violence in the area.
Local youths in Gossi captured bandits in their area and handed them over to Malian soldiers.
4 soldiers were wounded when their vehicle hit an IED about 30km from Hombori.

source: Afriquinfos; HRW; Nord Sud Journal; Xinhua; AFP
notes: 8 Fulani villagers were killed ic Ke-Macina commune, including 6 in Fokobougou, 1 in Diawaribougou, and 1 in Nawel-Baba, by members of the Bambara ethnic group after a Bambara trader was killed in Diawaribougou the day before. The violence was stopped by Malian soldiers who intervened, but shortly after more people were reported killed. The final fatality count was at least 21 killed. Other sources say as many as 32 more were killed. At least 16 people were reported injured.

One militant was killed and 20 arrested during a Malian military operation in the Dialloube area that Ansar Dine affiliated militants are reported to frequent. Other people have also been reported missing following the operation.
Alleged Peuhl Islamist fighters killed a Bambara shopkeeper near the town of Ke-Macina
On 11 February 2017, unidentified assailants opened fire on 2 agents of the Water & Forests Department between Timissa and Djenne (Tominian, Segou), killed a guide and wounded the station chief.
Malian military forces allegedly killed 4 unarmed villagers and arrested several others in Dialloube village. The area is known for being frequented by militants, including Ansar Dine affiliates.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Property destruction: 4 trucks chartered by MINUSMA were reportedly burned between Boni and Hombori by unidentified gunmen. There were no reports of clashes or injuries.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Looting: The CMA has accused GATIA of stealing their vehicles in the Menaka area and subjecting residents fo violence. GATIA rejected the claims of violence done to the population. The Malian government confirmed the thefts of vehicles but not the violence.
A Malian military officer was shot 4 times by unidentified assailants and evacuated by French Barkhane troops. He later died of his injuries.
Violent protests were reported in Senou, just outside Bamako, where a crowd threatened to burn down the mayor's office. It was not reported what the people were protesting.
A Colombian nun was kidnapped by suspected FLM gunmen near Koutiala in the Sikasso region. The Colombian government claimed the FLM was responsible in April 2017.
A Malian soldier was killed and 4 others wounded when his vehicle hit a mine on the Goundam-Timbuktu road.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: 4 Chadian MINUSMA peacekeepers were wounded after their vehicle hit an IED on the Aguelhok-Tessalit road.
4 Malian soldiers were killed and 3 wounded in an attack by an unidentified armed group on their positions in Menaka. At least 2 attackers were injured in the attack.
At least 2 gendarmes were killed and 3 people wounded, including 1 civilian, in an attack by unidentified assailants on a checkpoint in Marina, near Mopti.
Property destruction: 3 trucks belonging to the French construction company SATOM were burned by unidentified gunmen in Niafunke.
1 gendarmerie officer was killed and 2 injured in an attack on the Djiandiori-Tenenkou road. Ansar Dine claimed responsibility.
3 people were injured in an attack by unidentified armed motorcycle riders on a market in the Zinda area of Gao.
The mayor of Mondoro was killed by unidentified assailants.
Clashes between presumed Ansaroul Islam members and Dogon militia on the outskirts of Douna, Mopti not far from the Burkina Faso border, one Dogon killed and Dogon militia forced to retreat.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a checkpoint in the Somadougou area. 2 civilians were wounded after the attack.
A local official was killed by unidentified armed assailants in Dinangourou.
The mayor of Mondoro was killed in front of his home in Douentza by unidentified assailants.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A MINUSMA vehicle hit a IED while traveling along the Gao-Gossi road, causing no injuries.
An angry mob ransacked and looted the shop of an alleged confessed murderer in the Djikoroni Para district of Bamako.
1 Malian soldier was killed and others wounded in an IED attack on the Hombori-Douentza road.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A MINUSMA peacekeeper was killed in a mortar attack on a UN camp in Aguelhok. 2 other peacekeepers were seriously injured in the attack.
Property destruction: Unknown gunmen entered a Chinese-owned entreprise 10km away from Ke-Macina and damaged 5 vehicles.
3 Malian soldiers were killed by a landmine while traveling on the Gao-Gossi axis.

Two other common graves previously reported on by Human Rights Watch have yet to be investigated by the Malian authorities. The first, according to four witnesses from Yirima (35km from Boni), allegedly contains three members of an extended family detained by soldiers on January 21 and later executed.
3 Malian soldiers were killed in a landmine explosion in the Diabaly area.
3 people arrested by FAMA soldiers at Yirma were allegedly executed in front of the villagers of Banguel.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
actor2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: 13 GATIA members and one suspected CMA fighter were killed in an alleged CMA attack on GATIA fighters in the Tin Essako area of the Kidal region.
An IED attack against the Malian army was reported in the Goma-Coura area of Diabaly. Significant casualties were reported (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
A Malian army checkpost was attacked in Goundam by unidentified armed group. 1 person was killed, 4 injured and a vehicle and arms seized.
An employee of the mayor's office in Salem, north of Timbuktu, was abducted by an unidentified group.
The mayor of Boni was assassinated by unidentified gunmen.

assoc_actor_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
assoc_actor_2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: At least 55 people were killed (including a bomber) and 100 wounded in a suicide car attack at a military camp in the northern city of Gao in Mali. The area houses government soldiers and armed groups who conduct mixed patrols under a UN-brokered peace deal aimed at curbing violence in the region. The perpetrators were Al Mourabitoun allied with AQIM. In mid-Feb MINUSMA revised the death toll down from 77 to 54.
Teachers working in northern Mali in areas such as Timbuktu, Gao, Kidal, menaka and Taoudeni have started limited service over demands for risk premiums.
2 people were killed by an IED blast outside the ANPE office in Kidal.
An explosion involving either an IED or Grad rocket was reported in Gao. No details about target or injuries.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: AQIM claimed a grad rocket attack targeting French forces at Timbuktu airport. It was not clear if the rockets caused any injuries/damage.

5 Malian soldiers were killed and 3 wounded when their vehicle hit a roadside explosive while traveling between Diafarabe and Macina. The explosive was suspected of being planted by Islamist militants who regularly attack Malian security forces in the area.
Arrests: French military forces arrested the mastermind of the Grand Bassam (Ivory Coast) attack which left 19 people dead in March 2016. The arrest was made in the village of Gossi in Mali.
On 10 January 2017, a suspected cattle thief was killed by unidentified armed group between Dala and Kerena in the Douentza area (Moptil).
On 9 January, unknown gunmen abducted three young men of the Imghad tribe in the area of Tidarmene.
A Malian military patrol was ambushed in Fafa village by unidentified assailans. After a gunfight, 3 assailants were arrested and handed over to the local gendarmerie.
The Mourabitoun Battalion claimed responsibility for an attack on FAMA soldiers at a checkpoint in Ansongo. No casualties reported.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: "One security guard working for the ICRC was shot and killed during an altercation with two men on a motorcycle in Gao."

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Mali)
notes: An ICRC official was killed in Gao by unidentified assailants.
Unidentified gunmen attacked the Malian gendarmerie in Gossi. The gendarmerie offices and a hanger were set on fire during the attack.
A French woman who runs a humanitarian organization focused on helping children was kidnapped in Gao by Al Mourabitoune
A Malian police officer was killed and another wounded in an attack on a police station at Saye in Mopti.
Unidentified gunmen occupied the Boni area in Mopti without violence.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Non-violent activity: The main Tuareg rebel coalition suspended its participation in the peace process, accusing the Malian government of failing to prevent recent violence and lack of progress on promised reforms.
5 men were detained by Malian soldiers in Isseye village in the Douentza area. Their bodies were allegedly later discovered in a mass grave near the village.

Two other common graves previously reported on by Human Rights Watch have yet to be investigated by the Malian authorities. The second grave allegedly contains five men from Isseye village detained and executed by soldiers on December 19, 2016
5 men from Isseye village were detained and later executed by Malian soldiers near Yirma.
4 Malian soldiers were killed by unidentified assailants who ambushed a convoy headed to Sevare from Boni.

actor2: Police Forces of Mali (2013-) Prison Guards
notes: At least one prison guard was killed, another person injured, and between 50-93 prisoners released in an attack on a jail claimed by Ansar Dine.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: On 4 December, a convoy of GATIA combatants entered the village of Tidarmene, seized three vehicles and five motorbikes, two other vehicles were damaged, three shops were also looted and two civilians abducted, they were released a few hours later.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: On 3 December, a convoy of GATIA combatants entered the village of Inguizal in the cercle of Tidarmene, several shops were looted and civilians mistreated. Several property also stolen in the area in the days that followed.
On 1 December, unknown gunmen attacked a civilian transport bus near Gringale, wounding seven passengers including three severely, Malian soldiers were among the passengers on board the bus.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: 2 people were killed in clashes between suspected CMA and GATIA fighters between Tessit and Intillit near the Nigerien border.

actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: A GATIA vehicle hit an IED in Kidal, killing 5 of its members. Ansar Dine is suspected in planting the explosive.

A lookout, who turned out to be a minor, was killed by a French helicopter patrol near Tigabatene, 60km from Tessalit. The patrol was looking for people planting roadsibe explosives after a few French vehicles had been attacked over the past month.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: AQIM claimed a grad rocket attack on a French military base at Timbuktu airport. None of the rockets landed in the perimeter of the base however.

assoc_actor_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: The Al Mourabitoun Battalion, a sub-group of the AQIM, claimed a suicide car bombing which targeted a UN facility at Gao airport. No one was injured besides the bomber. Another car bomb was allegedly detonated remotely around the same time.
Ansar Dine claimed an IED attack against French forces in the Abeibara locality. No casualties were reported.

actor1: ANSIPRJ: National Alliance for the Protection of the Fulani Identity and the Restoration of Justice
notes: A Peul ethnic militia, the National Alliance for the Protection of the Peul (Fulani) Identity, have agreed to give up their arms and join the reconciliation process.
A candidate for local elections was kidnapped in the Koro region on voting day.
5 Malian soldiers transporting ballot boxes were killed and others wounded during an ambush by suspected Islamist fighters in the Douentza area. Other sources said the CMA carried out the attack.

actor2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: 4 Malian soldiers were killed and several others injured during an ambush by suspected CMA fighters in the Bambara-Maounde area.

An Islamist militia attacked the town of Dilli, killing one civilian and stealing 2 ambulances before heading for the Mauritanian border. This occurred in the evening following local elections in Mali.
Property destruction: Ballot boxes were seized and burned in Timbuktu, as well as other cities in the north.

actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Ansar Dine attacked on Wednesday a convoy of armed Tuareg Tribe in the Kidal region. Three fighters of Gatia were killed. The attack took place in the locality of Tisawached (Kidal region), not far from the Algerian border.
Two Malian soldiers were wounded when members of Al-Mourabitoun on motorcycles attacked an army position near Gao.
An IED blast hit a French vehicle in the Abeibara area near Aguelhok. Ansar Dine has claimed responsibility.

An armed Islamist group executed the head of the village of Diaba. One villager said he believed the killing was a warning to the community to not work with the Malian army, whose presence had recently been reinforced in the area.
An international NGO convoy was attacked Monday night Nov. 7 near Timbuktu, at ten kilometers of Tounka, and the vehicle stolen. The toll is three dead in the shooting.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Mali (2013-) Prison Guards
source: Twitter; AFP; Long War Journal; Maghreb Emergent; AP
notes: A policeman and a Malian prison officer were missing Monday, allegedly abducted, after an attack by Ansar Dine on the night of Sunday to Monday against the Malian town of Banamba. Two vehicles of the Gendarmerie were seized by the gunmen. According to the sources, the attackers arrived in Banamba "aboard a dozen vehicles" were immediately divided into three groups. One group attacked the local gendarmerie, another group attacked the jail to free prisoners, and a third headed a bank on site to force the safe. 21 inmates were released from a prison. One of the two missing men was found on Nov. 8 while the second on Nov. 9.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
source: AFP; Long War Journal; Al Akhbar (Egypt)
notes: A UN peacekeeper from Togo and two Malian civilians were killed Sunday at around 10:30 am (1030 GMT) when a MINUSMA logistics convoy was the target of a complex attack 45 kilometres (30 miles) north of Douentza, in the Mopti region. After a mine or improvised explosive device was detonated and the attackers opened fire on the convoy. Many sources reported Ansar Dine has claimed the responsibility while on Nov. 8 the Al-Akhbar website reports El Mourabitoune has also claimed responsibility for detonating a bomb that targeted Malian army truck although there are no more confirmations about.

Ansar Dines forces attacked a military camp in Gourma Rhaous, in Tombouctou, burning military equipment and temporarily taking control over the outpost. Additionally, the group claimed to capture 5 vehicles, burned another 6, and captured at least one DShK machine gun. It also reported that one of its own fighters was killed in that attack.

A French soldier was killed by a landmine. On the same day, a third French vehicle was hit by an IED near Kidal. All three were claimed by Ansar Dine. Ansar Dine claimed responsibility for the attack. The killing of this soldier raised the French victims in Mali to 16, since January 2013.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
assoc_actor_2: Tuareg Ethnic Group (Mali); Al Furqan Battalion
notes: Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM), on Friday night released a video showing the execution of 4 people, including two Tuareg captives and two other Malians, Mohamed Ould Beih and El-Hussein, accused of collaboration with the French military forces in Mali to fight the jihadists. Location unidentified.
Hundreds of people marching in protest against the appointment of the interim authorities in the North of Mali

Non-violent activity: On 30 October 2016 al-Qaedas rival Islamic State group (IS) reported it had received a pledge of allegiance by "Al-Murabitun" under the leadership of Abu-al-Walid al-Sahrawi, while part of Al-Murabitun remains loyal to al-Qaeda.

The Mujahideen attacked a French barrack in the city of Kidal with several shells and missiles. No casualties were reported, but two Bangladeshi helicopters were damaged by the rockets. Ansar Eddine claimed responsibility for the attack.
3 civilians were killed when unidentified gunmen attacked a toll post in Dialakoroba. The assailants allegedly shouted "Allahu Akbar" during the events.
A nurse was killed when unidentified gunmen opened fire on a vehicle belonging to a health centre in the Dimamou area of Mopti. Jihadist militants were suspected in the attack.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: AQIM abducted the chief of Kel Ansar Tuareg militia end October 2016 on suspicion of collaboration with Malian security forces. He was released by JNIM - a newly formed Al Qaida entity - early May 2017.

4 soldiers were killed during an ambush by suspected Macina Liberation Front gunmen (based on similar attacks by the group), which began after one of their vehicles hit a landmine . The attack took place as their convoy was traveling between Diabaly and Nampala. 9 soldiers were also seriously wounded.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A suspected Islamist suicide bomber detonated his vest in an attempted attack on Swedish MINUSMA peacekeepers in Timbuktu on the night of Oct.10. No casualties were reported however.
6 French soldiers were lightly wounded when their vehicle hit an IED or mine north of the Abeibara area.
About 1,000 people demonstrated in Bamako to demand an end to legal action against a popular radio host.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
assoc_actor_1: HCUA: High Council for the Unity of Azawad
notes: The military leader of the HCUA, a member of the CMA coalition, was killed when his vehicle hit a mine in the Kidal after a meeting at MINUSMAs offices in the area.
At least 2 Malian soldiers were killed and 2 injured when their vehicle hit a land mine in the Timbuktu area. No group claimed responsibility.

assoc_actor_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb

A civilian was killed by a landmine in the Aguelhok area.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Ansar Dine fighters claimed a Grad rocket attack on a UN base in the Aguelhok area. No casualties were reported but a truck was destroyed. A second round of firing using mortars later in the day did no damage. After the first round of shelling, a Chadian patrol sent out to find the culprits hit an IED claimed by Ansar Dine. One peacekeeper was killed in the blast and at least 5 were seriously wounded; one later died of his injuries. Finally, an ambulance belonging to the Chadian MINUSMA contingent was hit by an IED as it went to pick up injured from the earlier IED. 8 people were injured during the events in total.

assoc_actor_1: URD: Union for the Republic and Democracy
notes: According to the police, at least 2,000 people (opposition est. 100,000) engaged in a march in Bamako called by Malis opposition to demand the return of former Malian Presdient Amadou Toumani Toure, and to protest against a new electoral law and alleged state censorship. Opposition leader Soumaila Cisse of the URD spoke during the event, while former prime minister Modibo Sidibe was also present. Police seem to have been present but did not intervene.
A Malian soldier and a civilian were killed in an allegedly Islamist militant ambush in Timbuktu.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: A national guardsmen was executed by AQIM in Timbuktu. The circumstances of his capture were not reported.

Ansar Dine claimed responsibility for an attack on a military checkpost in the town of San. They stormed the building, stole weapons and motrocycles, and burnt it down before retreating. No casualties were reported.

notes: About 40 suspected Ansar Dine fighters attacked Boni and forced the retreat of Malian military forces to the south of the city. No casualties were reported.

Ongoing youth protests despite the interdiction of security forces due to troubles which caused 4 dead and 35 wounded.

Deputy mayor of the Wouro-Mody, Kola H. Dia, was killed on Monday by unidentified attackers.

Authorities said the gunmen arrived early Saturday in a white pickup truck, opened fire on a military checkpoint and stole a military vehicle in the town of Dinangourou.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb

Two Malian soldiers were killed and at least four injured when their convoy was ambushed on the road between Nampala and Diabaly. The military responded and seized a number of light weapons.

actor1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A MINUSMA camp in Aguelhoc was targeted by mortar fire by a suspected Islamist militants. No casualties or damage was reported.

assoc_actor_1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A Malian armed forces convoy containing MINUSMA vehicles was ambushed by suspected Islamist militias who used IEDs. 1 Malian soldier was wounded, while 1 Malian military vehicles and 2 MINUSMA vehicles were damaged.
7 civilians were killed by unidentified gunmen riding on a motorcycle near the border with Burkina Faso in the Kobou area.
6 people were killed by Fulani in Mondoro allegedly connected to a continuation of an ongoing dispute between Fulani and Dogono farmers.

The Malian army claims to have destroyed a "jihadist military camp", during operations which occurred in the Fakola area of the Sikasso region. 3 militants were allegedly killed during these operations. The militants found there were reportedly from various groups, including Ansar Dine.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: French special forces killed Al-Qaida leader Ali Ag Wadossene and arrested several others in an operation in the Tigharghar mountains of the Kidal region. Two special forces were wounded.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: AQIM attacked a MINUSMA convoy on the road between Timbuktu and Goundam, killing at least 6 peacekeepers and wounding 5.
Soldiers killed three "militants" during a search operation for jihadists in the Sama forest.
Ansar Dine jihadists attacked the town of Fakola near the border with Ivory Coast. They took control of a section of the town before being chased away by the army. Three jihadists were killed.

A group of Ansar Dine Islamists likely from the Peul ethnic group attacked the military outpost of Nara village and were repelled by the military. Twelve were killed including 9 militants and 3 soldiers.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Agreement: The CMA signed a peace deal known as the "Algiers Accord" that the government and loyalist militias signed May 15th.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
assoc_actor_2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: GATIA pro-government forces withdrew from Menaka to pave the way for a peace deal, allowing the military and MINUSMA peacekeepers to take control.

assoc_actor_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
assoc_actor_2: MUJAO: Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa
notes: Security sources say 14 Al Mourabitoune fighters were killed in clashes with "Al-Qaida affiliated" groups near Gao, and that former MUJAO head Adnane Abou El Walid El Sahraoui was seriously injured.

Dozens of Islamist militants on motorcycles attacked security forces in Misseni, killing at least one policeman and wounding two. They raised the flag of Ansar Dine before escaping, as the Malian army sent backup forces. At least two members of the Dawa Islamist sect with suspected ties to Ansar Dine were later arrested in connection with the incident.
A group from Guinea "stormed" the Malian village of Sanafara to carry out illegal gold mining and exchanged fire with Malian genderames for about four hours.
A civilian was reportedly killed by an armed group about 30km north of Timbuktu.
A civilian was kidnapped and shot dead. The CMA claims that the victim was targeted by pro-government groups for his support of their rebellion.
A civilian was killed by armed men traveling in a vehicle near the town of Goundam.

actor1: Movement of the Liberation of Maasina
notes: A group called the Movement of the Liberation of Massina made up primarily of the Fulani ethnic group and possibly linked to Al-Qaida engaged in "intense fighting" with government troops in the Massina region. Some claim the government troops have injured, killed and arrested Fulani civilians as a result, but those details have not been verified.
Armed men assassinated local elected leader Mohamedou el Maouloud Ag Mohamedoun about 100km from Timbuktu.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A rocket fired from a plateau overlooking Gao fell on the nearby MINUSMA camp, causing no casualties.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Three UN troops were wounded when their convoy hit a landmine in the Timbuktu region between Dire and Ber. AQIM later claimed responsibility for the attack.
More than 200,000 people marched in support of the peace and reconciliation process known as the "Algiers agreement" that was signed May 15th.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Unidentified assailants opened fired on two UN peacekeepers in a clearly marked UN vehicle in Bamako, killing one and wounding another. No group has claimed responsibility and the UN is conducting an investigation.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
assoc_actor_2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Al-Qaida in the Islamic Maghreb launched rockets at a MINUSMA camp while soldiers were negotiating with CMA leaders inside.
People from the Fulani ethnic group are fleeing the towns of Dioura and Nampala, south of Timbuktu, claiming that the Malian army has been raiding their camps, beating and arresting them.
People from the Fulani ethnic group are fleeing the towns of Dioura and Nampala, south of Timbuktu, claiming that the Malian army has been raiding their camps, beating and arresting them.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Militants launched a failed six-rocket attack at MINUSMA barraks near Timbuktu. MINUSMA returned fire but not casualties were reported.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: The Coordination of Azawad Movements battled with Malian troops in the town of Tessit, capturing up to 19 soldiers and injuring at least one.

assoc_actor_1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: 6 - 9 civilians, including an aid worker, were killed after fighting near the Tin Hama village. After a battle with rebels, GATIA pro-government troops reportedly handed several civilians over to Malian soldiers who publicly executed them. The Malian government did not confirm the claims and the UN is investigating.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Rebels attacked the town of Tin Hama being held by GATIA pro-government troops and briefly took over before the Malian military intervened and chased the rebels out.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Rebels attacked the town of Tin Hama being held by GATIA pro-government troops and briefly took over before the Malian military intervened and chased the rebels out.

assoc_actor_2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A gunman set fire to a UN car and then opened fire on a UN residence in Bamako and threw grenades before escaping. He shot and wounded a civilian guard but no troops were injured.

actor1: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad
notes: At least 3 Malian soldiers were killed and one injured in an attack by the MAA.

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: In a raid in the far northeast, French special forces killed four jihadists, two of whom were key AQIM leaders, including Amada Ag Hama and Ibrahim Ag Inawalen.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Heavily armed CMA militants fought with GATIA pro-government forces in and around Menaka. At least 24 were injured but the death toll is unknown.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Protesters threw rocks at MINUSMA troops in Kidal, professing opposition to Tuareg involvement in a peace deal.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Renewed fighting took place in Menaka between pro-government and separatist groups.

actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
assoc_actor_2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Agreement: Malis government signed a peace accord with three representatives of pro-Bamako militias and two minor members of the CMA rebellion under a team of mediators led by Algeria. The CMA had initialled the deal a day earlier, but its three principal factions did not attend the final signing. This "Algiers Accord" calls for the creation of election regional assemblies but not autonomy or federalism for the rebel groups.

Non-violent activity: The Al-Murabitoun jihadist group declared allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria. Later reports indicated that the statement was made by Adnan Abu Walid and rejected by presumed leader Belmokhtar, indicating a potential schism in the Al-Mourabitoun leadership.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Attacks took place between CMA rebel fighters and GATIA pro-government fighters in the northern town of Ikadewan in the Gao area, leaving at least four dead.
Around 200 women marched in Bamako, calling for peace in the north.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: The Coordination of Azawad Movements ambushed Malis defense forces near Tin Telout, killing at least nine and injuring fourteen. Civilians were also caught in the crossfire but casualty numbers are unknown.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Two peacekeepers were seriously injured when their vehicle struck a landmine near Tenenkou.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: The MINUSMA camp in Kidal was targeted by 6 - 8 mortar shells but did not sustain any material damages or casualties. MINUSMA forces "responded to the attack."
A vehicle hit an explosive device near the MINUSMA camp in Kidal and two civilians were injured.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: The CMA militant group attacked Tenenkou, and the resulting battle with the Malian military left 10 militants and 1 soldier dead and several injured.
Thousands marched to call for peace in the north and to express solidarity with the GATIA pro-governent militia.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad fighters attacked the town of Dire, and two militants were killed. The town remains under Malian military control.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Dozens of gunmen from the Coordination of Movements of the Azawad stormed a northern town, killing one and taking six hostage.
Four civilians were killed and 28 injured when their minibus drove over a landmine near the Doro locality between Gossi and Gao.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad militants opened fire on troops in Goundam, killing two soldiers and a child.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: The Coordination of Movements of the Azawad ambushed armed forces in the central town of Lere, leading to a battle that left 10 militants and 9 soldiers dead. Government troops remain in control of the town.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad militants fired on MINUSMA vehicles near Timbuktu.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
actor2: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
notes: GATIA pro-government forces retook positions in Menaka near the Niger border. They claim to have been initially attacked by MNLA fighters 40km south of Menaka, and the resulting battle led to overtaking the city.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Seven UN peacekeepers were wounded when a mine exploded.
A village chief, Amadou Issa Dicko, was assassinated by two unidentified assailants.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A MINUMSMA convoy was attacked by unknown assailants about 30 km west of Gao, leaving the driver dead.

assoc_actor_2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Two drivers were shot dead in an attack on a peacekeeping supply convoy in northern Mali. The attack took place some 15 kilometres (nine miles) from the main city of Gao. A third person was wounded.

actor1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: The militant Sahara-based Al-Murabitun group, which is led by the Algerian jihadist figure, Mokhtar Belmokhtar, has claimed responsibility for the 15 April attack on a UN camp in Ansongo, Northern Mali, which resulted in the deaths of three people, including civilians, and wounded nine peacekeepers.
3 soldiers were injured, one seriously, after their vehicle hit a mine near Boni.
One civilian was killed after his bike hit an explosive near Aguelhoc.
A Malian military vehicle struck a roadside bomb in the south, killing two soldiers and wounding three others. The attack took place Sunday in Malis Segou region between Niono and Diabaly.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Two MINUSMA peacekeepers were injured in a landmine explosion.
Four gunmen on motorbikes stormed a weekly fair, firing shots in the air and then killing a uniformed worker at the Ministry of Water and Forests.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: French special forces killed at least two Al Qaeda militants and injured others in an operation where they rescued a Dutch national who had been kidnapped in 2011.
Militants shelled Gao, killing one and wounding three.
In a suspected militant attack, a bomb was detonated in a private residence, killing one and injuring four. It is unclear whether the intended target was a French national living nearby.
Two armed men on motorcycles attacked a village, firing at the police station and town hall. They killed two civilians and injured a gendarme.
A 16 year old girl was killed by a landmine while herding her sheep near Asongo.
Gunmen attacked a Malian military position near Burkina Faso and a firefight ensued, resulting in the death of three militants.

actor1: MUJAO: Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa
assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Mali)
notes: At least six jihadists opened fire on a truck from the International Committee of the Red Cross and Crescent, killing one and injuring one. The truck was later found burned down.
Hundreds of supporters of exiled former president Amadou Toumani Toure called for his return in rallies held in Mopti and Gao.
Hundreds of supporters of exiled former president Amadou Toumani Toure called for his return in rallies held in Mopti and Gao.
Over one thousand supporters of exiled former president Amadou Toumani Toure rallied to call for his return.
Armed men stole a Malian government vehicle, prompting a guard to open fire as the men escaped.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: Al Qaida fighters shot a man in the head in front of villagers and then decapitated the victim. They accused him of working with French forces in Operation Barkhane.

actor2: Military Forces of Mali (2013-) Special Forces
notes: Malian special forces raided the apartment of the suspects from the recent militant attack at a Bamako nightclub. At least one suspect fought back, explosions were heard, and the special forces killed at least one suspect, arrested about a dozen others, and three special forces sustained slight injuries.
2 soldiers killed and 6 injured by roadside bomb.

actor1: MUJAO: Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa
notes: 2 Malian civilians were kidnapped by jihadists as they tried to drive towards Niger.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A peacekeeper and two children were killed and several wounded when unknown militants shelled a UN base with more than 30 rockets and MINUSMA soldiers returned fire. Two civilians outside the camp died in the crossfire.
An angry mob lynched and burned the bodies of two Arab teenagers whom they believed had planted bombs in the area.
Ater shooting several civilians at a nearby club, GMA shot and killed a police officer, a security guard, and a Belgian citizen on the street.

At least one gunman from the Al Mouribitoune jihadist group entered a club after midnight, threw grenades and opened fire, killing at least five people - including a French and a Belgian national - and wounding several.
French soldiers clashed with a group of 8- 10 men, killing four and injuring several who fled.
Shortly after a peace accord was signed by leaders in Algiers, hundreds of demonstrators in Kidal rallied in opposition.

Clashes occurred between Malian and Guinean miners between Feb.25-27, leaving a total of 6 dead. At least 3 people were found dead between Feb.26-27 in the Niawouleni territory of Mali, in the Sanfara area.

Clashes occurred between Malian and Guinean miners between Feb.25-27, leaving a total of 6 dead. At least 3 people were found dead between Feb.26-27 in the Niawouleni territory of Mali, in the Sanfara area.
Clashes occurred between Malian and Guinean miners between Feb.25-27. Clashes at the Sanfara site led to 3 (unspecified) dead and several Malians wounded.

actor1: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Rival armed groups from the MNLA and GATIA clashed in the Tessalit area. The MNLA accuses the Malian army of fighting alongside GATIA, but the government denies this. Casualties figures unknown.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A "militant action" seriously wounded 6 Nigerien MINUSMA soldiers on the road between Asongo and Menaka.
An army vehicle hit a mine near Timbuktu, death toll unknown.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Pro-government armed groups took control of the town of Tabrichat in clashes with rebels.
Military police repelled an attack by unidentified "militants" on their station in the western town of Dogofiry.
French forces killed a dozen "jihadists" in a firefight in the extreme north, injuring several and taking two or three prisoner. They seized a large arms consignment and destroyed vehicles.

actor1: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
assoc_actor_1: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad
notes: Tuareg rebels clashed with progovernmental forces overnight near Kano. Rockets were fired, one person was killed, and 20 people were briefly taken captive.
An armed group attacked the village of Bamba, firing shots into the air and raiding shops. No deaths or injuries were reported.

assoc_actor_2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: An armed group attacked the Kano village, kidnapping 20 -50 and killing one with a rocket. The villagers were all released shortly after thanks to pressure by MINUSMA.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
actor2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: GATIA attacked a rebel Tuareg and anti-government Arab position near Tabankort, and at the same time 3 suicide bombings or rocket shells exploded, killing 12 total.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A huge crowd of youth stormed the MINUSMA headquarters in Gao, throwing stones and molotov cocktails. MINUSMA responded with tear gas and live ammunition, killing three and injuring four. A UN inquiry determined Rwandan policekeeping police used excessive force by opening fire on the crowd.
Malian troops were ambushed near Timbuktu. One gendarme was killed and one was injured; four of the attackers were killed.
Malian troops on their way to provide security for a weekly market in Douekire were ambushed by an unknown group. Two Malian soldier died and three were wounded.
Demonstraters in Gingal, a village near Mopti, marched in protest of French magazine Charlie Hebdos caricatures of the prophet Mohammed.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Tuareg protesters said they pushed UN personnel from an airfield, burning generators and tearing down tents. MINUSMA soldiers fired tear gas and warning shots but eventually fled.

actor1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
actor2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: In an exchange of fire with a car of Tuareg rebels, a MINUSMA helicopter shot missiles that killed four of the rebels.
Gunshots were heard and shells fired on Kidal. It is uknown who is responsible.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: "militants" attacked a MINUSMA camp in Kidal, killing 1 Chadian peacekeeper and injuring another. The attackers used a car bomb and artillery in their assault, but were repulsed. The attackers "suffered losses" (coded as 10).
Thousands of Malian Muslims marched to protest against the publication of cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad by Charlie Hebdo.
MINUSMA reported clashes between armed groups covered by the ceasefire in the area around Tabakort in the Gao region.
3 Malian soldiers and 1 civilian were killed when FLM attacked Tenenkou. 5 other military personnel were also injured during the attack and 6 assailants killed.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A gunmen on a motorcyle opened fire on a UN vehicle carrying peacekeepers from Niger killing 1. The man is allegedly part of the El Mourabitoune group.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: 7 Senegalese UN peacekeepers were injured when their vehicle hit an explosive device while driving near Kidal airport.
9 deaths are recorded in Tenenkou between 8 and 16. FLM attacked soldiers, casualties unknown (4 recorded elsewhere).
An unidentified armed group shelled the city, targeting primarily military camps and the airport. No casualties were reported.
Suspected Islamist militants killed 1 person in an attack on Djoura, a village about 465 km northeast of Bamako.

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: At least 3 Malian soldiers were killed in an attack by an AQIM militants on a Malian army camp in Nampala, after which the army retreated. The militants arrived in about a dozen vehicles.

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: Malian military forces regrouped with reinforcements and attacked AQIM militants who had pushed them out of the town earlier in the day. At least 8 soldiers were killed and 9 wounded according to military sources, while "huge losses" (coded as 10) were suffered by the AQIM miliants.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Property destruction: North of Gao, armed men burned 7 trucks contracted by MINUSMA to carry equipment, after ordering their drivers out. No casualties were reported.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)

actor1: MUJAO: Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa
notes: 4 MUJAO fighters on motorcycles ambushed a car driving a Tuareg commander and mayor of Idheranbouker municipality, killing the driver and wounding the commander. He later died on his way to Bamako. His son was also killed in the attack.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad

notes: A CMA patrol clashed with GATIA fighters.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Ansar Dine has claimed a rocket attack on a joint-MINUSMA/Operation Barkhane (French) base. No casualties were reported.

notes: The MAA has taken control of Taoudeni, an area that controls an important oil field.

actor1: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
assoc_actor_1: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad
notes: GATIA has claimed that a group made up of MNLA and MAA members raided Bamba. They allegedly stole property and kidnapped a resident of the town.

notes: 3 Chadian peacekeepers were injured when their vehicle hit a mine near Aguelhoc. They were able to track down the bomb-layer and arrested 2 people found with heavy weapons.

A joint operation by French and Malian armed forces killed at least 7 militant Islamists of the al-Murabitoun group, and at least 3 were taken prisoner. Among those killed was Ahmed el Tilemsi, the leader of the group.

3 Malian civilians from the same family were kidnapped by armed men near Menaka. They are believed to have been taken by MUJAO, as other attacks have taken place in the same area carried out by MUJAO.

actor1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: 3 Chadian peacekeepers were injured, one seriously, when their vehicle hit a mine near Aguelhoc.

French forces have carried out 5 days of air operations, including airstrikes, over the Amettetai valleys in northern Mali. Four arms caches were destroyed and training camps were targeted. Casualties were not reported.
Two soldiers killed and four or more wounded in a convoy providing security to a government minister when they drove over a landmine.

assoc_actor_1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-); Military Forces of Chad (1990-)
notes: 38 to 100 Chadian MINUSMA soldiers abandoned their base in protest of late payments and demanding better working conditions. They returned after two days when MINUSMA agreed to improve camp conditions.
In Aguelhok and Kidal, suspected al-Qaeda-linked rebels kidnapped 10 children and killed 2 others who tried to escape.
In Aguelhok and Kidal, suspected al-Qaeda-linked rebels kidnapped 10 children and killed 2 others who tried to escape.
Detonation: A suicide bomber blew himself up in a market, causing no casualties or major property damage. No group claimed the attack.
2 Tuaregs who had disappeared earlier in November on the border with Algeria were found dead near Kidal bound in a mat and a blanket. It is not clear who killed them.
2 youths were kidnapped from a convoy traveling from Algeria to Gao. They were taken by armed men near Anefis. Reports disagree about motives for the kidnapping.
2 youths on a motorcycle opened fire on a bar, killing a young man and injuring 6 civilians, 4 seriously. The attackers are believed to have been Islamist militants.

assoc_actor_2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: 3 civilians were wounded when their truck hit a mine.
The Malian military has allegedly besieged the town of Bira near Timbuktu.
2 soldiers were killed and at least 4 other wounded by a roadside explosive device near the town of Almoustrate.
